brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts signaling bits for transmission using non-return to zero (NRZ). A one bit is represented by a positive voltage pulse, and a zero bit is represented by zero voltage. The height of the positive voltage pulse is the amplitude. The width of a pulse or absence of one is one bit-time.

Characteristics of NRZ include:
- Discrete pulses (not continuous)
- Can only have one of two states (1/0, on/off)
- Voltage jumps between levels
